author: Mitch Anderson
description:
Is our country more important than another oil pipeline? Apparently not, according to Alberta Premier Danielle Smith. On the very day that Prime Minister Mark Carney was flying to Washington for a high stakes meeting with President Trump, Smith delivered a speech demanding pre-approved oil corridors to the Pacific, Atlantic and Arctic coasts under the barely veiled threat […]

The post Top Free-Market Think Tank Unsure That Canada Needs More Pipelines appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Top Free-Market Think Tank Unsure That Canada Needs More Pipelines

author: Sam Bright
description:
The Institute of Economic Affairs (IEA) pressure group, which campaigns against clean energy policies, is being investigated by the charities regulator. The Good Law Project (GLP), a legal advocacy group, yesterday announced that it had been successful in forcing the Charity Commission to open a “regulatory compliance case” against the IEA. A Charity Commission spokesperson […]

The post Institute of Economic Affairs Under Investigation by the Charity Commission appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Institute of Economic Affairs Under Investigation by the Charity Commission

author: Adam Barnett
description:
A Reform UK mayor who claims “net zero madness” is “bankrupting Britain” has called for investment in an offshore wind project “to boost growth” in the local economy. Dame Andrea Jenkyns, who was elected as Greater Lincolnshire Mayor in the 1 May local elections, has been a vocal opponent of climate action and renewable energy […]

The post Anti-Net Zero Reform Mayor Andrea Jenkyns Urges Offshore Wind Investment appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Anti-Net Zero Reform Mayor Andrea Jenkyns Urges Offshore Wind Investment
